inventory.commentary: Propbank cost.01 only accounts for the financial aspect of sense 1

sense.name: have a particular price or cause to pay a price
sense.examples: This shirt costs 80 dollars! I want to buy a pack of gum that costs fifty-five cents. It costs more to live in a city. Atomic energy costs a lot. That costs. Participating in the strike cost me my job. My dumb mistake cost her forty hours of extra work. It didn't cost me a penny. The red flag cost him millions of dollars.

sense.name: COSTED - to estimate or determine cost of
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] COSTED NP2[patient] NP1[patient] COSTED
sense.examples: Operations must be fully costed. The accountants costed out our expenses. These budgets have not costed the time of people who will attend.
